channel.title: Michael Smith News
channel.description: Maureen's son, Katarina's husband and lapsed radio broadcaster's views.

item.title: Imagination that left Australia bigger and better. Patriots on each side. Vale Labor.
item.content:encoded: <object data="http://abfiles.s3.amazonaws.com/swf/fullsize_player.swf" height="129" id="boo_embed_1331321" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="400"> <param name="movie" value="http://abfiles.s3.amazonaws.com/swf/fullsize_player.swf" /> <param name="scale" value="noscale" /> <param name="salign" value="lt" /> <param name="bgColor" value="#FFFFFF" /> <param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always" /> <param name="wmode" value="window" /> <param name="FlashVars" value="mp3=http%3A%2F%2Faudioboo.fm%2Fboos%2F1331321-labor-lost.mp3%3Fkeyed%3Dtrue%26source%3Dembed&mp3Title=Labor+lost&mp3Time=08.24pm+15+Apr+2013&mp3LinkURL=http%3A%2F%2Faudioboo.fm%2Fboos%2F1331321-labor-lost&mp3Author=michaelsmithnews&rootID=boo_embed_1331321" /><iframe allowtransparency="allowtransparency" cellspacing="0" frameborder="0" hspace="0" marginheight="0" marginwidth="0" scrolling="no" src="http://audioboo.fm/boos/1331321-labor-lost/embed" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: none; display: block; width: 400px; height: 145px;" title="Audioboo player" vspace="0"></iframe> </object> <iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/z1WpWSGQ82w" width="420"></iframe>
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: The ABC is a bit toey over a Liberal Party ad comparing Gillard's expertise on borders with her promises on gang crime
item.description: Here's a link to the ABC's story - here's a screen grab to give you the sense of it. The Liberal Party can speak for itself, but I want to make a few comments here that might have escaped the ABC's partisan view. I don't see any link here, any...
item.content:encoded:
Here's a link to the ABC's story - here's a screen grab to give you the sense of it.

The Liberal Party can speak for itself, but I want to make a few comments here that might have escaped the ABC's partisan view.

I don't see any link here, any suggestion that the Liberal Party is linking asylum seekers to street crime.  As I read it, the Liberal Party is comparing Gillard's track record on border control with her promise to fix gang crime and shootings in Sydney's West.

Border Control is Gillard's responsibility.   She's buggered it up monumentally.   Then she of her own volition says she'll take on gang crime - it's quite reasonable for her political opponents to say, "well look at her track record on borders, how the hell would you trust them on street crime?"

The Liberals didn't make the claim that Gillard would fix gang crime, Gillard's Labor Government did, it jumped right into it.

http://www.michaelsmithnews.com/2013/01/why-would-anyone-think-julia-gillard-able-to-improve-any-government-service.html

http://www.michaelsmithnews.com/2013/03/julia-gillard-to-hunt-down-organised-crime-any-clues-on-where-she-could-start.html

They've stuffed up border control, it's not unreasonable to think they'll screw up gang crime too.
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: A Liberal Party campaign ad. You can check it to see if it's accurate. Its claims are annotated. Compare and Contrast.
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: The Prime Minister with Brig and Lehmo
item.description: http://www.gold1043.com.au/shows/breakfast/listen/brig-lehmo-get-their-hands-on-the-pm Ending the blame game? Ending the fight? GILLARD: Over years and years and years what we’ve seen is schools and school systems having to fight for resources. We’ve often seen school systems pitted against each other – Catholics and independents versus government schools. I want to end all of...
item.content:encoded:
http://www.gold1043.com.au/shows/breakfast/listen/brig-lehmo-get-their-hands-on-the-pm

Ending the blame game?   Ending the fight?

GILLARD: Over years and years and years what we’ve seen is schools and school systems having to fight for resources.

We’ve often seen school systems pitted against each other – Catholics and independents versus government schools.

I want to end all of that, I want to get this right for all time.

Any school you send your kids to will have the right resources to give them a great education and that money will be used to genuinely improve their education.

More support for kids’ learning, more improvement plans in schools, more things like librarians and literacy coaches, things that really make a difference to the quality of education.

BRIG: I think everybody is behind that, getting the greatest education, but what worries me is it has to come, sadly, at the expense of universities.

PM: Our universities are very precious to us, which is why since we came to government we’ve increased funding to them by more than 50 per cent.

That’s a lot of money, and funding for universities is going to continue to grow.

Every university will get more money next year and the year after and the year after than they have this year.

What we are asking them to do is to have a lower growth rate to help us fund these important changes for kids around the country.

So more money in universities, so each year they’ll get more money, a lower rate of growth is what we’re asking for.

PS - GILLARD said this about her beloved, her defacto, he with whom she will share the super and with whom she currently shares the Lodge's grog cellar

LEHMO: Probably just as well. Julia, we should start by asking you how Tim is because we know he was on a bike ride yesterday for the charity Hagar and he bumped into a kerb or came undone at some point?

PM: Yes I heard the story when I got home last night, so coming round one of the Canberra roundabouts he almost ran out of road and hit the kerb, but he is fine and he was full of tales about the ride and then of course full of teasing about Tigers versus Dogs yesterday.

I just don’t want to go into it!

LEHMO: Tough weekend for the Bulldogs. Have you ever jumped on the back of the bike with Tim in charge?

PM: No I haven’t, and just as well really by the sound of it.
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: Jason Clare has subbied out illegal boat arrival welcomes to Customs
item.description: This is the last press release from Jason Clare for an illegal boat arrival, it's from Sunday, 14 April. The Minister's press advisor tells me that when there's an acting minister, Customs does the welcome press releases. So here are two from today from Customs: Yes, Broome - again on...
item.content:encoded:
This is the last press release from Jason Clare for an illegal boat arrival, it's from Sunday, 14 April.


The Minister's press advisor tells me that when there's an acting minister, Customs does the welcome press releases.   So here are two from today from Customs:


Yes, Broome - again on the coast of Western Australia.
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: The unspeakable James Peters, the hepatitis C anaesthetist appeals his sentence
item.description: These are the sentencing remarks of Justice Terry Forrest when he sentenced the unspeakable former doctor James Peters who infected 55 women with Hepatitis C. Unspeakable. This creature is appealing the severity of his 14 year sentence. I hope it takes the justice system 5 seconds to deal with his...
item.content:encoded:
These are the sentencing remarks of Justice Terry Forrest when he sentenced the unspeakable former doctor James Peters who infected 55 women with Hepatitis C.

Unspeakable.   This creature is appealing the severity of his 14 year sentence.   I hope it takes the justice system 5 seconds to deal with his wish.

Download Sentencing remarks peters
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith
